content: State Newton's Second Law.

subject: Biology

subject: Math
content: Evaluate:  \( \int x^{2} \, dx \)

subject: Physics
content: State Newton's Second Law.
solution: Force equals mass times acceleration: \( F = ma \).

subject: Chemistry
content: Which is the functional group of alcohols?
solution: The functional group of alcohols is \(-OH\).

subject: Biology
content: Explain Mendel's law of segregation.
solution: Mendel's law states that allele pairs separate during gamete formation.

subject: Math
content: \(\sin(\theta) = ?\)
solution: The sine of an angle is the ratio of the opposite side to the hypotenuse.

subject: Physics
content: Derive lens formula.
solution: The lens formula is \( \frac{1}{f} = \frac{1}{v} - \frac{1}{u} \). Derivation involves geometry and sign conventions.

subject: Biology
content: What is food?
solution: Food is any substance consumed to provide nutritional support for the body.

subject: Math
content:
Evaluate: \( \int \sin x \, dx \)
A. \( -\cos x + C \)
B. \( \cos x + C \)
C. \( \sin x + C \)
D. \( -\sin x + C \)

subject: Math
content:
Let A = \{0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5\}. Let \( R \) be a relation on \( A \) defined by \( (x, y) \in R \) if and only if \( \max(x, y) \in \{3, 4\} \).
Then among the statements:
(S1): The number of elements in \( R \) is 18
(S2): The relation \( R \) is symmetric but neither reflexive nor transitive
Which of the following is correct?
(a) Only S1 is correct
(b) Only S2 is correct
(c) Both S1 and S2 are correct
(d) Neither S1 nor S2 is correct
solution: Correct option: (c) Both S1 and S2 are correct

subject: Math
content: Prove that the function \( f(x) = 5x - 3 \) is continuous at \( x = 0 \), at \( x = -3 \) and at \( x = 5 \).

subject: Math
content: Examine the continuity of the function \( f(x) = 2x^{2} - 1 \) at \( x = 3 \).

subject: Math
content: Examine the following functions for continuity: (a) \( f(x) = x - 5 \), (b) \( f(x) = \frac{1}{x - 5}, x \neq 5 \), (c) \( f(x) = \frac{x^{2} - 25}{x + 5}, x \neq -5 \), (d) \( f(x) = |x - 5| \).

subject: Math
content: Prove that the function \( f(x) = x^{n} \) is continuous at \( x = n \), where \( n \) is a positive integer.

subject: Math
content: Is the function \( f(x) = \begin{cases} x, & \text{if } x \leq 1 \\ 5, & \text{if } x > 1 \end{cases} \) continuous at \( x = 0 \), \( x = 1 \), and \( x = 2 \)?

subject: Math
content: Find all points of discontinuity of \( f(x) = \begin{cases} 2x + 3, & x \leq 2 \\ 2x - 3, & x > 2 \end{cases} \).

subject: Math
content: Find all points of discontinuity of \( f(x) = \begin{cases} |x| + 3, & x \leq -3 \\ -2x, & -3 < x < 3 \\ 6x + 2, & x \geq 3 \end{cases} \).

subject: Math
content: Find all points of discontinuity of \( f(x) = \begin{cases} \frac{|x|}{x}, & x \neq 0 \\ 0, & x = 0 \end{cases} \).

subject: Math
content: Find all points of discontinuity of \( f(x) = \begin{cases} \frac{x}{|x|}, & x < 0 \\ -1, & x \geq 0 \end{cases} \).

subject: Math
content: Find all points of discontinuity of \( f(x) = \begin{cases} x + 1, & x \geq 1 \\ x^{2} + 1, & x < 1 \end{cases} \).

subject: Math
content: Find all points of discontinuity of \( f(x) = \begin{cases} x^{3} - 3, & x \leq 2 \\ x^{2} + 1, & x > 2 \end{cases} \).

subject: Math
content: Find all points of discontinuity of \( f(x) = \begin{cases} x^{10} - 1, & x \leq 1 \\ x^{2}, & x > 1 \end{cases} \).

subject: Math
content: Is the function \( f(x) = \begin{cases} x + 5, & x \leq 1 \\ x - 5, & x > 1 \end{cases} \) continuous?

subject: Math
content: Discuss the continuity of the function \( f(x) = \begin{cases} 3, & 0 \leq x \leq 1 \\ 4, & 1 < x < 3 \\ 5, & 3 \leq x \leq 10 \end{cases} \).

subject: Math
content: Discuss the continuity of the function \( f(x) = \begin{cases} 2x, & x < 0 \\ 0, & 0 \leq x \leq 1 \\ 4x, & x > 1 \end{cases} \).

subject: Math
content: Discuss the continuity of the function \( f(x) = \begin{cases} -2, & x \leq -1 \\ 2x, & -1 < x \leq 1 \\ 2, & x > 1 \end{cases} \).

subject: Math
content: Find the relationship between \( a \) and \( b \) so that the function \( f(x) = \begin{cases} ax + 1, & x \leq 3 \\ bx + 3, & x > 3 \end{cases} \) is continuous at \( x = 3 \).

subject: Math
content: For what value of \( \lambda \) is the function \( f(x) = \begin{cases} \lambda (x^{2} - 2x), & x \leq 0 \\ 4x + 1, & x > 0 \end{cases} \) continuous at \( x = 0 \)? Also discuss continuity at \( x = 1 \).

subject: Math
content: Show that the function \( g(x) = x - [x] \) is discontinuous at all integral points, where \( [x] \) denotes the greatest integer less than or equal to \( x \).

subject: Math
content: Is the function \( f(x) = x^{2} - \sin x + 5 \) continuous at \( x = \pi \)?

subject: Math
content: (a) Discuss the continuity of the function \( f(x) = \sin x + \cos x \). (b) Discuss the continuity of \( f(x) = \sin x - \cos x \). (c) Discuss the continuity of \( f(x) = \sin x \cdot \cos x \).

subject: Math
content: Discuss the continuity of the cosine, cosecant, secant, and cotangent functions.

subject: Math
content: Find all points of discontinuity of \( f(x) = \begin{cases} \frac{\sin x}{x}, & x < 0 \\ x + 1, & x \geq 0 \end{cases} \).

subject: Math
content: Determine if \( f(x) = \begin{cases} x^{2} \sin \frac{1}{x}, & x \neq 0 \\ 0, & x = 0 \end{cases} \) is a continuous function.

subject: Math
content: Examine the continuity of \( f(x) = \begin{cases} \sin x - \cos x, & x \neq 0 \\ 1, & x = 0 \end{cases} \).

subject: Math
content: Find the values of \( k \) so that the function \( f(x) = \begin{cases} \frac{k \cos x}{\pi - 2x}, & x \neq \frac{\pi}{2} \\ 3, & x = \frac{\pi}{2} \end{cases} \) is continuous at \( x = \frac{\pi}{2} \).

subject: Math
content: Find the values of \( k \) so that the function \( f(x) = \begin{cases} k x^2, & x \le 2 \\ 3, & x > 2 \end{cases} \) is continuous at \( x = 2 \).

subject: Math
content: Find the values of \( k \) so that the function \( f(x) = \begin{cases} kx + 1, & x \le \pi \\ \cos x, & x > \pi \end{cases} \) is continuous at \( x = \pi \).

subject: Math
content: Find the values of \( k \) so that the function \( f(x) = \begin{cases} kx + 1, & x \le 5 \\ 3x - 5, & x > 5 \end{cases} \) is continuous at \( x = 5 \).

subject: Math
content: Find the values of \( a \) and \( b \) such that the function \( f(x) = \begin{cases} 5, & x \le 2 \\ ax + b, & 2 < x < 10 \\ 21, & x \ge 10 \end{cases} \) is continuous.

subject: Math
content: Show that the function \( f(x) = \cos(x^2) \) is continuous.

subject: Math
content: Show that the function \( f(x) = | \cos x | \) is continuous.

content: Examine that \( \sin |x| \) is a continuous function.

subject: Math
content: Find all the points of discontinuity of \( f(x) = |x| - |x + 1| \).

subject: Math
content: Find the rate of change of the area of a circle with respect to its radius \( r \) when (a) \( r = 3\;\text{cm} \), (b) \( r = 4\;\text{cm} \).

subject: Math
content: The volume of a cube is increasing at the rate of \( 8\;\text{cm}^3/\text{s} \). How fast is the surface area increasing when the length of its edge is \( 12\;\text{cm} \)?

subject: Math
content: An edge of a variable cube is increasing at the rate of \( 3\;\text{cm}/\text{s} \). How fast is the volume of the cube increasing when the edge is \( 10\;\text{cm} \) long?

subject: Math
content: A stone is dropped into a quiet lake and waves move in circles at the speed of \( 5\;\text{cm}/\text{s} \). At the instant when the radius of the circular wave is \( 8\;\text{cm} \), how fast is the enclosed area increasing?

subject: Math
content: The radius of a circle is increasing at the rate of \( 0.7\;\text{cm}/\text{s} \). What is the rate of increase of its circumference?

subject: Math
content: The length \( x \) of a rectangle is decreasing at the rate of \( 5\;\text{cm}/\text{min} \) and the width \( y \) is increasing at the rate of \( 4\;\text{cm}/\text{min} \). When \( x = 8\;\text{cm} \) and \( y = 6\;\text{cm} \), find the rates of change of (a) the perimeter, and (b) the area of the rectangle.

subject: Math
content: A balloon, which always remains spherical on inflation, is being inflated by pumping in 900 cubic centimeters of gas per second. Find the rate at which the radius of the balloon increases when the radius is \( 15\;\text{cm} \).

subject: Math
content: A balloon, which always remains spherical has a variable radius. Find the rate at which its volume is increasing with the radius when the latter is \( 10\;\text{cm} \).

subject: Math
content: A ladder \( 5\;\text{m} \) long is leaning against a wall. The bottom of the ladder is pulled along the ground, away from the wall, at the rate of \( 2\;\text{cm}/\text{s} \). How fast is its height on the wall decreasing when the foot of the ladder is \( 4\;\text{m} \) away from the wall?

subject: Math
content: A particle is moving along the curve \( 6y = x^3 + 2 \). Find the points on the curve at which the \( y \)-coordinate is changing 8 times as fast as the \( x \)-coordinate.

subject: Math
content: The radius of an air bubble is increasing at the rate of \( \frac{1}{2}\;\text{cm}/\text{s} \). At what rate is the volume of the bubble increasing when the radius is \( 1\;\text{cm} \)?

subject: Math
content: A balloon, which always remains spherical, has a variable diameter \( \frac{3}{2}(2x + 1) \). Find the rate of change of its volume with respect to \( x \).

subject: Math
content: Sand is pouring from a pipe at the rate of \( 12\;\text{cm}^3/\text{s} \). The falling sand forms a cone on the ground in such a way that the height of the cone is always one-sixth of the radius of the base. How fast is the height of the sand cone increasing when the height is \( 4\;\text{cm} \)?

subject: Math
content: The total cost \( C(x) \) in Rupees associated with the production of \( x \) units of an item is given by \( C(x) = 0.007x^3 - 0.003x^2 + 15x + 4000 \). Find the marginal cost when 17 units are produced.

subject: Math
content: The total revenue in Rupees received from the sale of \( x \) units of a product is given by \( R(x) = 13x^2 + 26x + 15 \). Find the marginal revenue when \( x = 7 \).

subject: Math
content:
The rate of change of the area of a circle with respect to its radius \( r \) at \( r = 6\;\text{cm} \) is:
(A) \( 10\pi \)  (B) \( 12\pi \)  (C) \( 8\pi \)  (D) \( 12\pi \)

subject: Math
content: The total revenue in Rupees received from the sale of \( x \) units of a product is given by \( R(x) = 3x^2 + 36x + 5 \). The marginal revenue when \( x = 15 \) is

subject: Math
content: Show that the function given by \( f(x) = 3x + 17 \) is strictly increasing on \( \mathbb{R} \).

subject: Math
content: Show that the function given by \( f(x) = e^{2x} \) is strictly increasing on \( \mathbb{R} \).

subject: Math
content: Show that the function given by \( f(x) = \sin x \) is strictly increasing on \( (0, \frac{\pi}{2}) \), strictly decreasing on \( (\frac{\pi}{2}, \pi) \), and neither increasing nor decreasing on \( (0, \pi) \).

subject: Math
content: Find the intervals in which the function \( f(x) = 2x^2 - 3x \) is strictly increasing and strictly decreasing.

subject: Math
content: Find the intervals in which the function \( f(x) = 2x^2 - 3x^2 - 36x + 7 \) is strictly increasing and strictly decreasing.

subject: Math
content: Show that \( y = \log (1 + x) - \frac{2x}{2 + x},\,x > -1 \), is an increasing function throughout its domain.

subject: Math
content: Find the values of \( x \) for which \( y = [x(x - 2)]^2 \) is an increasing function.

subject: Math
content: Prove that \( y = \frac{4\sin \theta}{(2 + \cos \theta)} - \theta \) is an increasing function of \( \theta \) in \( \left[ 0, \frac{\pi}{2} \right] \).

subject: Math
content: Prove that the logarithmic function is strictly increasing on \( (0, \infty) \).

subject: Math
content: Prove that the function \( f(x) = x^2 - x + 1 \) is neither strictly increasing nor strictly decreasing on \( (-1, 1) \).

subject: Math
content: Which of the following functions are strictly decreasing on \( \left( 0, \frac{\pi}{2} \right) \)? (A) \( \cos x \) (B) \( \cos 2x \) (C) \( \cos 3x \) (D) \( \tan x \)

subject: Math
content: On which of the following intervals is the function \( f(x) = x^{100} + \sin x - 1 \) strictly decreasing? (A) \( (0,1) \) (B) \( \left( \frac{\pi}{2}, \pi \right) \) (C) \( \left( 0, \frac{\pi}{2} \right) \) (D) None of these

subject: Math
content: Find the least value of \( a \) such that the function \( f(x) = x^2 + ax + 1 \) is strictly increasing on \( (1,2) \).

subject: Math
content: Let \( I \) be any interval disjoint from \( (-1,1) \), prove that the function \( f(x) = x + \frac{1}{x} \) is strictly increasing on \( I \).

subject: Math
content: Prove that the function \( f(x) = \log \sin x \) is strictly increasing on \( \left( 0, \frac{\pi}{2} \right) \) and strictly decreasing on \( \left( \frac{\pi}{2}, \pi \right) \).

subject: Math
content: Prove that the function \( f(x) = \log \cos x \) is strictly decreasing on \( \left( 0, \frac{\pi}{2} \right) \) and strictly increasing on \( \left( \frac{\pi}{2}, \pi \right) \).

subject: Math
content: Prove that the function \( f(x) = x^3 - 3x^2 + 3x - 100 \) is increasing on \( \mathbb{R} \).

subject: Math
content: The interval in which \( y = x^2 e^{-x} \) is increasing is (A) \( (-\infty, \infty) \) (B) \( (-2, 0) \) (C) \( (2, \infty) \) (D) \( (0, 2) \)

subject: Math
content: Find the maximum and minimum values, if any, of the following given by (i) f(x) = (2x - 1)^2 + 3 (ii) f(x) = 9x^2 + 12x + 2 (iii) f(x) = - (x - 1)^2 + 10 (iv) g(x) = x^3 + 1.

subject: Math
content: Find the maximum and minimum values, if any, of the following functions given by (i) f(x) = |x + 2| - 1 (ii) g(x) = - |x + 1| + 3 (iii) h(x) = sin(2x) + 5 (iv) f(x) = |sin 4x + 3| (v) h(x) = x + 4, x in (-1, 1).

subject: Math
content: Find the local maxima and local minima, if any, of the following functions. Find also the local maximum and the local minimum values, as the case may be: (i) f(x) = x^2 (ii) g(x) = x^3 - 3x (iii) h(x) = sin x + cos x, 0 < x < π/2 (iv) f(x) = sin x - cos x, 0 < x < 2π (v) f(x) = x^3 - 6x^2 + 9x + 15 (vi) g(x) = x/2 + 2/x, x > 0 (vii) g(x) = 1/(x^2 + 2) (viii) f(x) = x sqrt(1 - x), x > 0.

subject: Math
content: Prove that the following functions do not have maxima or minima: (i) f(x) = e^x (ii) g(x) = log x (iii) h(x) = x^3 + x^2 + x + 1.

subject: Math
content: Find the absolute maximum value and the absolute minimum value of the following functions in the given intervals: (i) f(x) = x^3, x in [-2, 2] (ii) f(x) = sin x + cos x, x in [0, π] (iii) f(x) = 4x - 1/2 x^2, x in [-2, 9/2] (iv) f(x) = (x - 1)^2 + 3, x in [-3, 1].

subject: Math
content: Find the maximum profit that a company can make, if the profit function is given by p(x) = 41 - 24x - 18x^2.

subject: Math
content: Find the intervals in which the function f given by f(x) = x^3 + 1/x^3, x ≠ 0 is (i) Increasing (ii) Decreasing.

subject: Math
content: At what points in the interval [0, 2π], does the function sin 2x attain its maximum value?

subject: Math
content: What is the maximum value of the function sin x + cos x?

subject: Math
content: Find the maximum value of 2x^3 - 24x + 107 in the interval [1,3]. Find the maximum value of the same function in [-3, -1].

subject: Math
content: It is given that at x = 1, the function x^4 - 62x^2 + ax + 9 attains its maximum value, on the interval [0, 2]. Find the value of a.

subject: Math
content: Find the maximum and minimum values of x + sin 2x on [0, 2π].

subject: Math
content: Find two numbers whose sum is 24 and whose product is as large as possible.

subject: Math
content: Find two positive numbers x and y such that x + y = 60 and x y^3 is maximum.

subject: Math
content: Find two positive numbers x and y such that their sum is 35 and the product x^2 y^5 is maximum.

subject: Math
content: Find two positive numbers whose sum is 16 and the sum of whose cubes is minimum.

subject: Math
content: A square piece of tin of side 18 cm is to be made into a box without top, by cutting a square from each corner and folding up the flaps to form the box. What should be the side of the square to be cut off so that the volume of the box is the maximum possible?

subject: Math
content: A rectangular sheet of tin 45 cm by 24 cm is to be made into a box without top, by cutting off square from each corner and folding up the flaps. What should be the side of the square to be cut off so that the volume of the box is the maximum possible?

subject: Math
content: Show that of all the rectangles inscribed in a given fixed circle, the square has the maximum area.

subject: Math
content: Show that the right circular cylinder of given surface and maximum volume is such that its height is equal to the diameter of the base.

subject: Math
content: Of all the closed cylindrical cans (right circular), of a given volume of 100 cubic centimeters, find the dimensions of the can which has the minimum surface area.

subject: Math
content: A wire of length 28 m is to be cut into two pieces. One of the pieces is to be made into a square and the other into a circle. What should be the length of the two pieces so that the combined area of the circle is minimum?

subject: Math
content: Prove that the volume of the largest cone that can be inscribed in a sphere of radius R is 8/27 of the volume of the sphere.

subject: Math
content: Show that the right circular cone of least curved surface and given volume has an altitude equal to √2 times the radius of the base.

subject: Math
content: Show that the semi-vertical angle of the cone of the maximum volume and of given slant height is tan^(-1)(√2).

subject: Math
content: Show that the semi-vertical angle of the right circular cone of given surface area and maximum volume is tan^(-1)(1/3).

subject: Math
content: The point on the curve x^2 = 2y which is nearest to the point (0,5) is: (A) (2√2, 4) (B) (2√2, 0) (C) (0,0) (D) (2,2).

subject: Math
content: For all real values of x, the minimum value of (1 - x + x^2) / (1 + x + x^2) is: (A) 0 (B) 1 (C) 3 (D) 1/3.

Force equals mass times acceleration: \( F = ma \).
Which is the functional group of alcohols?
The functional group of alcohols is \(-OH\).
Mendel's law states that allele pairs separate during gamete formation.

(S1): The number of elements in \( R \) is 18
(S2): The relation \( R \) is symmetric but neither reflexive nor transitive
Which of the following is correct?
(c) Both S1 and S2 are correct
(d) Neither S1 nor S2 is correct
